Codo » Index » Epoch » Chart » Plot

Class: Epoch.Chart.Plot

Defined in: coffee/charts.coffee
Inherits: Epoch.Chart.SVG

Overview

Base class for all two-dimensional d3 charts. This class handles axes and margins so that subclasses can focus on the construction of particular chart types.

Direct Known Subclasses

Epoch.Chart.Area Epoch.Chart.Bar Epoch.Chart.Line Epoch.Chart.Scatter

Instance Method Summary

  • # (void) setTickFormat(axis, fn) Sets the tick formatting function to use on the given axis.
  • # (Boolean) hasAxis(axis)
  • # (Number) innerWidth()
  • # (Number) innerHeight()
  • # (Function) x()
  • # (Function) y()
  • # (Function) bottomAxis()
  • # (Function) topAxis()
  • # (Function) leftAxis()
  • # (Function) rightAxis()
  • # (void) draw() Renders the axes for the visualization (subclasses must implement specific drawing routines).
  • # (void) _redrawAxes() Redraws the axes for the visualization.
  • # (void) _drawAxes() Draws the initial axes for the visualization.

Inherited Method Summary

Methods inherited from Epoch.Chart.SVG

#setData #update #draw #extent #on #off #trigger

Constructor Details

# (void) constructor(options = {})

Creates a new plot chart.

Parameters:

  • options ( Object ) — Options to use when constructing the plot.

Options Hash: (options):

  • margins ( Object ) — For setting explicit values for the top, right, bottom, and left margins in the visualization. Normally these can be omitted and the class will set appropriately sized margins given which axes are specified.
  • axes ( Array ) — A list of axes to display (top, left, bottom, right).
  • ticks ( Object ) — Number of ticks to place on the top, left bottom and right axes.
  • tickFormats ( Object ) — What tick formatting functions to use for the top, bottom, left, and right axes.

Instance Method Details

# (void) setTickFormat(axis, fn)

Sets the tick formatting function to use on the given axis.

Parameters:

  • axis ( String ) — Name of the axis.
  • fn ( Function ) — Formatting function to use.

# (Boolean) hasAxis(axis)

Parameters:

  • axis ( String ) — Name of axis to check.

Returns:

  • ( Boolean ) — true if the chart has an axis with a given name, false otherwise.

# (Number) innerWidth()

Returns:

  • ( Number ) — Width of the visualization portion of the chart (width - margins).

# (Number) innerHeight()

Returns:

  • ( Number ) — Height of the visualization portion of the chart (height - margins).

# (Function) x()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — The x scale for the visualization.

# (Function) y()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — The y scale for the visualization.

# (Function) bottomAxis()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — d3 axis to use for the bottom of the visualization.

# (Function) topAxis()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — d3 axis to use for the top of the visualization.

# (Function) leftAxis()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — d3 axis to use on the left of the visualization.

# (Function) rightAxis()

Returns:

  • ( Function ) — d3 axis to use on the right of the visualization.

# (void) draw()

Renders the axes for the visualization (subclasses must implement specific drawing routines).

# (void) _redrawAxes()

Redraws the axes for the visualization.

# (void) _drawAxes()

Draws the initial axes for the visualization.
